publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1976 Karen Whitefield: National Carers' Week: 11-17 June 2001—That the Parliament pledges its support to National Carers’ Week from 11 to 17 June 2001; acknowledges the huge contribution which carers make to society as the mainstay of care in the community; welcomes the publication of the report from the Scottish Carers’ Legislation Working Group and the ongoing consultation by the Scottish Executive on proposals for carers’ legislation; notes with concern the findings in the Carers’ National Association Scotland research document You can take him home now on carers’ experience of hospital discharge, and calls on the Scottish Executive to consider the findings of that document during the formulation of its next Programme for Government and to work with health boards and organisations throughout Scotland to implement the recommendations made in the report and the research document.

S1M-1976 National Carers' Week: 11-17 June 2001 (lodged on 29 May 2001) Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Cathie Craigie*, Kate MacLean*, Elaine Thomson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Patricia Ferguson*, Margaret Jamieson*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Trish Godman*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Karen Gillon*, Bill Butler*, Mike Watson*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Andy Kerr*, Helen Eadie*, Janis Hughes*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Hugh Henry*, Cathy Jamieson*, Scott Barrie*, Cathy Peattie*, Irene Oldfather*, Des McNulty*

S1M-1976 Karen Whitefield: National Carers' Week: 11-17 June 2001—That the Parliament pledges its support to National Carers’ Week from 11 to 17 June 2001; acknowledges the huge contribution which carers make to society as the mainstay of care in the community; welcomes the publication of the report from the Scottish Carers’ Legislation Working Group and the ongoing consultation by the Scottish Executive on proposals for carers’ legislation; notes with concern the findings in the Carers’ National Association Scotland research document You can take him home now on carers’ experience of hospital discharge, and calls on the Scottish Executive to consider the findings of that document during the formulation of its next Programme for Government and to work with health boards and organisations throughout Scotland to implement the recommendations made in the report and the research document. Supported by: Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Cathie Craigie, Kate MacLean, Elaine Thomson, Mr Frank McAveety, Patricia Ferguson, Margaret Jamieson, Dr Richard Simpson, Trish Godman, Mr Michael McMahon, Marilyn Livingstone, Karen Gillon, Bill Butler, Mike Watson, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Andy Kerr, Helen Eadie, Janis Hughes, Mr Duncan McNeil, Hugh Henry, Cathy Jamieson, Scott Barrie, Cathy Peattie, Irene Oldfather, Des McNulty
S1M-1976 National Carers' Week: 11-17 June 2001 (lodged on 29 May 2001) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-1976# National Carers' Week: 11-17 June 2001 (lodged on 29 May 2001) Bristow Muldoon*

S1M-1976# Karen Whitefield: National Carers' Week: 11-17 June 2001—That the Parliament pledges its support to National Carers’ Week from 11 to 17 June 2001; acknowledges the huge contribution which carers make to society as the mainstay of care in the community; welcomes the publication of the report from the Scottish Carers’ Legislation Working Group and the ongoing consultation by the Scottish Executive on proposals for carers’ legislation; notes with concern the findings in the Carers’ National Association Scotland research document You can take him home now on carers’ experience of hospital discharge, and urges the Scottish Executive to consider the findings of that document during the formulation of its next Programme for Government and to work with health boards and organisations throughout Scotland to implement the recommendations made in the report and the research document. Supported by: Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Cathie Craigie, Kate MacLean, Elaine Thomson, Mr Frank McAveety, Patricia Ferguson, Margaret Jamieson, Dr Richard Simpson, Trish Godman, Mr Michael McMahon, Marilyn Livingstone, Karen Gillon, Bill Butler, Mike Watson, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Andy Kerr, Helen Eadie, Janis Hughes, Mr Duncan McNeil, Hugh Henry, Cathy Jamieson, Scott Barrie, Cathy Peattie, Irene Oldfather, Des McNulty, Donald Gorrie, Alex Neil, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Bristow Muldoon, Linda Fabiani, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Tricia Marwick, Dr Winnie Ewing, Pauline McNeill, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, David Mundell, Irene McGugan, Dr Elaine Murray
